verses.roman:
anyathā go-vraje tasya
smaraṇīyaṁ na cakṣmahe
snehānubandho bandhūnāṁ
muner api su-dustyajaḥ

synonyms: anyathā—otherwise; go-vraje—in the cow pasture; tasya—for Him; smaraṇīyam—that which is worth remembering; na cakṣmahe—we do not see; sneha—of affection; anubandhaḥ—the attachment; bandhūnām—to relatives; muneḥ—for a sage; api—even; su-dustyajaḥ—very difficult to abandon.
translation: We see nothing else He might consider worth remembering in these cow pastures of Vraja. Indeed, the bonds of affection for one's family members are difficult to break, even for a sage.
